questions.clue: She was the first American woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean in 1932, often overshadowed by Amelia Earhart.
This woman became the first female medical doctor in the United States in 1849.
An African American mathematician, her calculations were critical to the early years of the U.S. space program.
She was the first woman to receive a U.S. patent in 1809 for her technique of weaving straw with silk and thread.
This French chemist and physicist was a pioneer in the study of radioactivity but received less acclaim than her Nobel Prize-winning sister.
Cherry blossoms bloom, / A city's heart in Japan, / Old meets new here now.
Landmarks line the Seine, / Lovers stroll past tall towers, / Light glows in cafes.
Taj Mahal glistens, / Sacred river flowing by, / It's the second most populous.
Art in ancient stone, / Jungles hide these mighty ruins, / Lost civilization.
Past arctic terrain, / Wolves roam free among tundra, / Aurora dances.
For 200 points: This ocean creature known for its bright colors can change the shape of its body to avoid predators.
For 400 points: This desert-dwelling lizard can squirt blood from its eyes as a defense mechanism.
For 600 points: This Antarctic fish has a natural antifreeze protein in its blood to survive subzero temperatures.
For 800 points: This insect can mimic the appearance and behavior of a leaf to avoid predation.
For 1000 points: This marsupial can slow its metabolism to conserve energy and survive periods without food.
This ancient civilization is credited with the creation of bread, using yeast to make it rise.
In the Middle Ages, this food, consisting of whole, often hollowed-out, loaves of bread, served as a type of edible plate.
Named after a city, this popular type of curry is said to have been invented in the 1940s at an eatery in Scotland.
Originating in Italy, this dish named after the goddess of love was traditionally made to appeal to the lover's eye first.
Requiring a discontinued variety of sheep, this prized 18th-century cheese from England was known for its rich taste.
In 'Home Alone', Kevin watches a gangster movie called 'Angels With Filthy Souls'.
The movie 'Machete' originated as a fake trailer in this 2007 Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez collaboration.
Ben Stiller's character is in a movie called 'Simple Jack' in this 2008 war-satire comedy.
In 'Scream 2', attendees watch a film about the events of 'Scream' titled this.
In 'Last Action Hero', the protagonist is given a magic ticket to enter the franchise of this action hero played by Arnold Schwarzenegger.

final.clue: This empire, known for its religious tolerance, was dissolved only 9 years after reaching its territorial peak in 1920.
